Joint New Year Editorial Hailed 
    Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Harish Gupta, secretary general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, made public a statement on Jan. 10 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the newspapers of the Party, the army and the youth league of the DPRK.
 Recalling that the DPRK achieved great successes in all fields glorifying the Songun era despite all sorts of hardships and ordeals under the tested and wise guidance of Kim Jong Il in 2005, he stressed in the statement that the achievements are a victory of the Songun policy which helped the Party, the army and the people achieve perfect single-minded unity.    
 He wished the DPRK brilliant successes in all fields including politics, economy and culture in 2006. Affirming that Asian regional adherents of the Juche idea and the Songun idea fully support Kim Jong Il, he expressed the firm belief that nothing can stop the onward movement of the Korean people.

Internet Homepage in Philippines Named "Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il E-Library" 
    Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Philippines-DPRK Friendship Society named its Internet homepage "Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il E-Library".
 A naming ceremony was held in Manila on Dec. 20 last year.    
 Nelia Sancho, executive chairman of the friendship society, declared that the Internet homepage was named "Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il E-Library".
 Referring to the circumstances and purpose of naming after the peerless great men, the executive chairman introduced works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", Korean film "Answer of Korea" and materials showing efforts of the Korean people to build a great prosperous powerful nation and achieve national reunification which were posted on it.

Struggle for Settlement of Past Called for 
    Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The drive for the settlement of the past in south Korea represents acute confrontation between progressive and conservative forces and between pro-reunification patriotic forces and anti-reunification traitorous forces, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed article.
 Calling on the south Koreans to unite as one in order to win a victory in this drive for the nation and justice, the article goes on:
 The drive is one to put an end to the outsiders' domination and interference and retake the usurped dignity and sovereignty of the nation.
 The south Koreans from all walks of life should keep the flaring flame of the struggle for independence against the U.S. to put an end to its cursed occupation and rule. All the crimes of the U.S. imperialists who have infringed upon the sovereignty and democracy of the south Korean people and inflicted all sorts of misfortune and disaster upon them while instigating the fascist dictatorial regimes to confrontation and war with the north during their 60 odd-year long occupation of south Korea should be settled without fail.    
 The drive for the settlement of the past is a struggle to settle accounts with all the crimes the successive fascist dictators and traitors related to the "Grand National Party" have committed following the evil habit of flunkeyism, treachery and fascist dictatorship against reunification.
 The crimes committed by those traitors from the Syngman Rhee regime framed up by the U.S. imperialists in south Korea right after Aug. 15 liberation of Korea, the "Yusin" dictatorial regime, the fifth and the sixth republics to the "civilian government" were anti-people, anti-national and anti-reunification treacheries which can never be pardoned. The repetition of the past can never be checked unless the wrong past is liquidated. 
 The drive for the settlement of the past in south Korea is one to ostracize the GNP, a traitorous political party.    
 It is impossible to realize the long-cherished desire of the south Koreans to liquidate the fascist dictatorship and materialize democratic politics as long as the GNP, the descendent of the successive traitorous regimes that had committed all sorts of anti-people and anti-national crimes, regarding flunkeyism, treachery, fascism and division as their way of existence, is left intact. If the GNP comes to power in south Korea it would be impossible to check the repetition of such a medieval age of darkness as that of "Yusin" dictatorship, much less expecting any progress in the movement for national reunification.
 All the parties, factions and people of all social standings in south Korea desirous of progress, patriotism and reunification should closely unite and solidarize to wage a joint struggle and take a joint action for the settlement of the past to the last and thus build an independent and democratic new society free from domination, treachery and fascism in south Korea without fail.
